snippet: The referendums are likely to entrench pro-Russian militant groups, while putting the government in Kiev in the awkward position of contesting an election.
abstract: Elections in eastern Ukraine pose risk of escalating smoldering conflict by entrenching political wins of pro-Russian militant groups, while putting interim government in Kiev in awkward position of arguing against what organizers describe as democratic vote; Pew Research Center releases poll indicating 70 percent of respondents in eastern Ukraine favor keeping country united, 18 percent favor right to secede and remainder are undecided.

byline.contributor: Noah Sneider and C. J. Chivers contributed reporting from Slovyansk, Ukraine.

lead_paragraph: The referendums are likely to entrench pro-Russian militant groups, while putting the government in Kiev in the awkward position of contesting an election.

headline.main: Amid Much Uncertainty, Separatists Prepare for Voting in Eastern Ukraine
headline.print_headline: Amid Much Uncertainty, Separatists Prepare for Voting in Eastern Ukraine
